iso_atomic_to_planetary.definition: Isomorphic patterns across atomic to planetary scales (expanded to include subatomic for complete hierarchy) capture structural equivalences in material and systemic hierarchies—mappings where interactions, assemblies, emergences, and self-organizations preserve relations invariantly. These include hierarchical integrations, energy flows, phase transitions, and topological persistences, validated via systems theory (e.g., phase-structural isomorphisms per web:0) and cross-scale analogies (e.g., quantum fluctuations to planetary ecosystems). Hard-to-vary invariants like recursive assembly and topological persistence enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox (affirm hierarchy/deny isolation/both in networks/neither in emergences); scores >0.98 based on 2025 physical abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns explicitly from subatomic through planetary scales plus principle to restore full hierarchy (correcting prior omission of subatomic); concrete from systems theory/web and material overlays (e.g., quantum fluctuations to planetary climates).
Validate coverage across full scales (subatomic → atomic → cellular → organism → social → technological → planetary); flag gaps as speculative (e.g., planetary-tech links).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., turbulent flows); integrate diachronic depth (quantum origins to 2025 geo-AI models).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve anisomorphisms; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.
